intro: Craspedophyllum cheesemanii, commonly known as the Cheeseman's craspedophyllum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form with small, leathery leaves. It produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
